result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney Demon Manns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rodney Demon Manns is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rodney Demon Manns was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Rodney Demon Manns was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Pay Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge by 5/5/2020.  DOC to take up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent with count three.  Credit for 30 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete a Cognitive  Thinking Behavioral Modification course.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two. 30 days of sentence credit.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ LNR 
Corrections made to the PSI. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
COUNT #2: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to count #3, credit for 30 days. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/5/2020, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/5/2020, DOC is to take up to 25% of prison funds;; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero. 
COUNT #3: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of 120 days in the House of Corrections CONCURRENT to COUNT #2. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification courseed.
-Work or school
-Defendant to complete 20 hours of community service. 
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
 On motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED.
AS TO COUNT 2:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court ordered a Presentence Report at the State's request with NO RECOMMENDATION. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Letters (x2) filed with the court on 2-17-16.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  
Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status and Sentencing.  Off the record conference held in chambers with counsels.  Case called on the record.  

As to Counts 1 and 2:  Parties engaged in negotiations; possible resolution on the next date.  Defense moves to hold bail motion in abeyance until the next date; the court to hold bail motion open.  The state is not seeking any action as to 2-15-16 gps violation.  The Court  takes no action on today, however the court may revisit this issue when considering defense bail motion.

As to Count 3:  Joint motion to adjourn sentencing heard and granted by the court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Jury in the box: 8:52 am. Jurors were instructed to continue deliberations. Jury out of the box: 8:53 am. Jury in the box: 2:01 pm. Jury is deadlocked as to Counts 1 and 2 but have a verdict as to Count 3. Jury out of the box: 2:04 pm. Defense moves for a mistrial as to Counts 1 and 2.   At the hour of 2:10 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to COUNT 3 which was then read. Court ordered a mistrial as to Counts 1 and 2. Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to Count 3. Case calendared for SENTENCING as to Count 3 and STATUS as to Counts 1 and 2 in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Jury in the box: 8:54 am. Court released the panel to continue deliberations. Jury out of the box: 8:56 am. Jury in the box: 10:20 am. Court addressed jury questions and replayed the 911 recordings. Jury out of the box: 10:36 am. Jury in the box: 4:29 pm. Court released the panel for the day. Jury out of the box: 4:31 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

P.M...CASE RECALLED...SAME APPEARANCES...

Trial resumed.  The Court reviews exhibits numbers received into evidence with counsels.  Defense informs the Court that defense is prepared to rest.  The Court holds colloquy with the defendant as to his right to testify and his right to remain silent.  Defendant indicates that he will not testify.  Signed Waiver of Right to Testify, received and filed.  Jury Instruction conference conducted.  Court in recess for short break.  Trial resumed.  On state's motion the Court amends the address contained Count 3 of the Amended Information to reflect: 3288 N. 24th Place.  Jury in at 2:07 p.m.  Defense rests.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:09 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies J. Cross and C. Perine who were duly sworn for that purpose.  

Jury in at 4:55 p.m.   The Court gives the jury warnings as to discussing, investigating, and social media reporting along with other general instructions.  Jury released for the day at 4:58 p.m.  Case continued to 1-19-16 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 15.

  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with Attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  
Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Jury Trial.  Trial resumed.  Jury in at 9:01 a.m.  Sworn for the state:  Deputy Administrator James Wilson (Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court).  Exhibit 83 offered by the state and received into evidence.  Sworn for the state: Detective Brian Hardrath (City of Milwaukee).  Exhibits offered by the state, received into evidence:  77, 86-99; exhibits 77, 86-88, 94-99 published.  Jury out at 10:11 a.m. Sidebar set forth.  Jury in at 10:35 a.m.  Jury out at 10:38 a.m.  Sidebar set forth.  Jury in at 10:49 a.m.  Sworn for the state:  Detective Dennis Devalkenaere (City of Milwaukee).  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 50, 84, and 85.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Forensic Investigator Sylvia Gerasch, Milwaukee Police Latent Print Examiner Douglas Knueppel, Controlled Substance Analyst Sandra Koresch (Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory), Firearms and Toolmark Examiner Mark Simonson (Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory).  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 51 and 52.  State rests subject to all exhibits being entered and rebuttal.  Jury out at 11:50 a.m. for lunch recess.  Defense motion to dismiss all three counts argued (by both counsels) and denied by the Court as set forth.  Court in recess until 1:00 p.m.

P.M...CASE RECALLED...SAME APPEARANCES...

Trial resumed.  Resworn for the state: Medical Examiner Jessica Lelinski, M.D. (Milwaukee County Medical Examiner's Office)  Exhibits offered by the state, received conditionally, and published: 26, 30(not published), 31, 33, 34, 27, 28 (not published), 29, 35-40.  Exhibits 47, 48, 44, 45 offered by the state and received into evidence.  Sworn for the state:  Police Services Investigator Michael Braunreiter (Milwaukee Police Department).  Exhibits 25-31 and 33-40, 22-24, 69 received.  Jury out at 2:07 p.m.  Attorney Andrew Golden present with citizen witness Leonardo C.  The Court holds colloquy with witness Leonardo C. and counsels regarding 5th amendment privilege.  The state is not willing to offer immunity to this witness.  Off the record in chambers conference held with counsels. Back on the record.  The state informs the court that it will offer witness Leonard C. immunity under 972.08.  Jury in 2:53 p.m.  Sworn for the state: citizen witness Leonardo C.  Exhibit #43 (audio file 5) played.  Jury released for the day at 4:43 p.m.  Court in recess for the day.  Case continued to 1-15-16 at 9:00 a.m. for Jury Trial  before Branch 15.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with Attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  
Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Jury Trial.  The Court and parties continue with objection as to Exhibit #43 (cd 911 calls).  Parties stipulate to the court listening to Exhibit #43 in open court outside the presence of the jury; exhibit 43 played.  Additional argument made by the state and defense.  The Court sets forth findings.  The Court rules that the 911 calls are authenticated and will admit said calls with the exception of call between the 911 telecommunicator and fire department.  Jury in at 10:37 a.m.  Resworn for the state: Detective Keith Kopcha (MPD).  Exhibit 43 offered by the state and received into evidence; defense objection noted.  Exhibit 82 offered by the state and received.  Exhibit 43 (audio files 1-5) played in open court; defense objection noted.  Testimony of Det. Kopcha resumed.  Sworn for the state: Jessica Lelinski, M.D.  Exhibit 25 offered and received into evidence conditionally; published to the jury.  Exhibits 22-24 offered by the state and received into evidence.  Jury out for the lunch hour at 11:56 p.m.  Sidebar set forth.  Court in recess until 1:00 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

P.M...CASE RECALLED...SAME APPEARANCES...
Deputy Court Clerk:  dds

Trial resumed.  Attorney Scott Anderson present on behalf of witness Terrance B.  Jury in at 1:24 p.m.  Resworn: Terrance B. Exhibit 11 offered by the state; defense objects; objection noted for the record.  Exhibit 11 received into evidence but not published.  Witness Terrance B. excused.  Witness and Attorney Scott Anderson exit.  Jury out for break at 2:21 p.m.  Sidebars set forth.  Court in recess for break.  During break Attorney Alexis Liggins appears to confer with citizen witness Leonardo C.  Trial resumed.  Jury in at 3:38 p.m.  Sworn for the state: Police Detective Brett Huston (Milwaukee Police Department).  Exhibit 79 offered by the state and received into evidence.  Sworn for the state: Detective Keith Kopcha.  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 41, 42.  Jury out at 4:25 p.m. to allow for additional discussion as to sidebar just taken. Argument made by counsels regarding 911 calls and hearsay.  Findings and rulings set forth by the Court.  Jury in at 4:59 p.m.  Jury released for the day at 5:00 p.m.  Court in recess.  Case continued to 1-14-16 at 9:00 a.m. for Jury Trial before Branch 15.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with Attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  
Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Jury Trial.  Trial resumed.  Attorney Alexis Liggins present on behalf of witness Terrance B.  Jury in at 9:40 a.m.  Resworn for the state:  citizen witness Terrance B.  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 3, 4, 7, 8, 6, 76, 10 (all published).  Exhibit 80 offered by the state; objection from defense.  Jury out at 10:41 a.m.  Argument from defense and state regarding Exhibit #80.  The Court overrules the objection; exhibit 80 received and may be published.  Court takes short break.  Trial resumed.  Jury in at 11:00 a.m.  The Court received Exhibit 80 in the presence of the jury; Exhibit 80 published.  Testimony of Terrance B. resumed.  Exhibit 81 offered by the state, received, and published.  Jury out for noon lunch break at 11:59 a.m.  Court in recess until 1:15 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

P.M...CASE RECALLED...SAME APPEARANCES...

Trial continued.  Jury in at 1:20 p.m.  Testimony of Detective Erik Villarreal resumed( previously sworn).  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence:  64 and 65 (published), 70, 71, 58, 59 and 63 (published).  Jury out at 1:56 p.m.  Sidebar set forth and discussed further.  Jury in at 2:13 p.m.  Testimony of Det. Vallarreal resumed.  Sworn for the state: citizen witness Terrance B.  Exhibit 2 offered by the state and received into evidence. During direct examination by the state witness Terrance B. invokes his 5th amendment right.  Jury out at 2:41 p.m.  Defense makes motion for mistrial.  Argument of defense and state heard.  Court in recess.  Trial resumed.  Attorney Terese Dick present on behalf of citizen witness Terrance B.  Attorney Dick indicates that witness Terrance B. wishes to withdraw his invocation of his 5th amendment privilege.  The Court denies motion for mistrial for reasons set forth.  Jury in at 3:58 p.m.  Testimony of Terrance B. resumed.  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 73-75, 5, 9 (published).  Jury released for the day at 4:55 p.m. and instructed to return in the a.m.  Court in recess for the day.  Case continued to 1-13-16 at 8:30 a.m. for Jury Trial before Branch 15.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with Attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  
Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Jury Trial.  Trial resumed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by the state and defense.  

Sworn for the state: Paramedic Richard Krygiel (Milwaukee Fire Department).  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 1, 17-19, 57 (all published).  Jury out for short break at 10:15 a.m.  Upon stipulation of the parties the Court amends the Amended Information to reflect the address as 24th Place as to Count 3.  Jury in at 10:36 a.m.  Sworn for the state: Police Officer Kim Lastrilla (City of Milwaukee).  Exhibit 60 offered by the state, received, and published.  Sworn for the state:  Detective Erik Villarreal.  Exhibits offered by the state and received into evidence: 46, 12-13 (published), 53, 14-16, 20, 21, 67, 68 (all published except 53), 54, 56.  Jury released for the noon lunch hour at 11:58 a.m.  Court in recess until 1:15 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Trial resumed.  Jury in at 4:12 p.m. Court instructed jury.  Jury given general instructions and released for the day at 4:43 p.m.  Sidebar set forth.  
Court in recess for the day.  Case continued to 1-12-16 at 8:45 a.m. for Jury Trial before Branch 15.

P.M......SAME APPEARANCES.....

Jury in at 1:33 p.m.  Voir dire resumed.  Jury out at 2:14 p.m.  Strikes for cause conducted outside the presence of the jury.  Court takes short break.  Trial resumed.  Parties approve of proposed preliminary instructions.  Jury in at 3:00 p.m.  Peremptory Strikes performed.   Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury sworn to try the issue.  Jury out at 3:30 p.m.  Sidebars set forth on the record.  Defense makes Batson challenge as to the panel.  Argument made by counsels.  The Court reviews strikes with counsels.  The Court finds that the defense has not made a prima facie case for purposeful discrimination.

dated 9-15-15 from Attorney Rodney L. Cubbie, received and filed.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Motion hearing proceeded. Defense will not be filing a motion to suppress or to sever Count 3.  
Defense first motion in limine was restated in defense third motion in limine. The Court admitted evidence of $1000.00 and 10.5 grams of THC and a scale found in the defendant's upper second floor residence with no objection by defense. State conceded that the 40 caliber firearm and other bags of THC and $4,650 found in the residence of Maleek G. in the lower apartment of 3288 N. 24th Street would not be offer by the State. As to the defense second motion in limine, the Court ruled that defense could not offer specific other prior bad acts but that testimony of Mr. S. could be offered for reputation of victim as a pertinent trait of character of the victim that the victim was a robber who wore gloves and concealed his identity and was violent.
No remaining issues. Case remains in jury posture.  
Court REITERATES to defense counsel of timely arrival of all future court appearance for defendant and defendant is advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings and comply with Justice Point. Case remains scheduled for Jury Trial on 9-21-015 at 8:30 am, branch 15.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

and Order for Funeral Pass signed and filed. Defendant is to have from 10:00 am to 3:00 pm on 8/22/2015 to attend his uncles funeral. sab

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Cubbie is moving to adjourn the jury trial that is scheduled for 9-29-2014 due to his current trial calendar.  The state has no objection.  The court will grant the adjournment but advises counsels that the court will not adjourn this matter again.  The state puts counsel on notice that additional charges may be forthcoming as detailed in the criminal complaint.
Case set for final pretrial on 10-16-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 11-3-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.

Defendant Rodney Demon Manns in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for status conference.  State had previously requested an increase in cash bail due to a Justice Point violation.  The defense provided a letter from WE Energies.  For reasons stated on the the record, the Court denies the state's motion to increase cash bail.  

The defense makes a motion that the GPS restrictions be modified.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defense motion to modify GPS restrictions.  

The defense makes a motion to adjourn the jury trial date.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court denies the defense motion to adjourn the jury trial date.  

Case remains calendared in Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.
